ideas.pillar_rationale: This content directly provides weather-specific driving safety guidance with actionable defensive driving techniques - core safety education.
ideas.core_message: The first hour of rain is the most dangerous on the road. Oil and debris rise to the surface before washing away. Brake earlier and straighter than your instincts tell you to stay safe.

source_idea.title: First hour of rain spikes incidents
key_points: First hour of rain spikes incidents

platform_adaptations.reddit: PSA: First hour of rainfall has significantly higher accident rates due to oil/debris surfacing before washing away. Counterintuitive safety tip that's saved me multiple times: brake much earlier and keep it straight during that initial hour. The road surface is slicker than it looks, and your normal braking distance assumptions don't apply. Worth sharing with new drivers especially.
